summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 11868, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Ninth Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, from Denny Way to Mercer Street, by constructing concrete sidewalks with wooden curbs, gutters, and crosswalks, together with such bulkheads as may be necessary in accordance with Resolution No. 129 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
